title.narrative: EQUITABLE ACCESS

description.narrative: By 2021, the Ministry of Social Development and Human Security and other lines ministries have enhanced capacity to effectively implement and monitor the provision of child-sensitive social protection for children (e.g. child support grant, disability grant, grant for poor students and others), which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Education â€“ General, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, the Ministry of Social Development and Human Security and other lines ministries have enhanced capacity to effectively implement and monitor the provision of child-sensitive social protection for children (e.g. child support grant, disability grant, grant for poor students and others)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, the Ministry of Social Development and Human Security and other lines ministries have enhanced capacity to effectivelyimplement and monitor the provision of child-sensitive social protection for children (e.g. child support grant, disability grant,grant for poor students and others)

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF accelerated its efforts to support children from marginalized communities during the pandemic. Key milestones include: (i) maintaining continuity of learning for nearly 10,000 linguistic minority and migrant children during school disruptions; (ii) collaborative advocacy with the Equitable Education Fund (EEF) on flexible learning access for marginalized children and support for teachers to promote equitable education in south-east Asia through evidence generation and knowledge exchange, the latter included an international virtual conference which engaged 1,500 participants across 22 countries; and;(iii) cabinet approval of the National Language Policy Action Plan which acknowledged the use of mother tongue education. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/01/2022
